body.name: Ninja CFP101 DualBrew Hot & Iced Coffee Maker, Single-Serve, compatible with K-Cups & 12-Cup Drip Coffee Maker, Black
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 7 hrs 44 mins
features: FASTER BREWING: Brew a coffee pod faster vs. Keurig K-Elite upon startup.

DUAL COFFEE MAKER: Grounds and pods coffee system with 9 grounds brew sizes (Small Cup, Cup, XL Cup, Travel Mug, XL Travel Mug, ¼ Carafe, ½ Carafe, ¾ Carafe, or Full Carafe) in addition to 4 traditional pod brew sizes (6, 8, 10, or 12 oz.).
3 BREW STYLE CHOICES: Select Classic, Rich, or Over Ice for your grounds or coffee pods.
ICED COFFEE: Brew fresh over ice for flavorful iced coffee that's never watered down.
KEEP WARM FUNCTION: Adjustable warming plate keeps coffee warm for up to 4 hours.
60-OZ. REMOVABLE RESERVOIR: Conveniently carry the 60-oz. removable water reservoir to your sink for easy filling.
FOLDABLE SINGLE SERVE PLATFORM: Elevates your coffee mug to reduce splashing of freshly brewed coffee.
THERMAL FLAVOR EXTRACTION DUO: Delivers perfect flavor for grounds and pods with even saturation and precise temperature control for ultra-flavorful coffee.
EASY CLEANING: Clean function, dishwasher-safe parts, and removable Ninja pod adapter allow you to easily deep clean your unit.
WHAT'S INCLUDED: Ninja DualBrew Hot & Iced Coffee Maker, Paper Filter Kit,12-Cup Glass Carafe, Ninja Pod Adapter, & Ninja Smart Scoop.
body.description: The Ninja DualBrew Grounds & Pods Hot & Iced Coffee Maker delivers Classic, Rich, and Over Ice brews from your favorite coffee grounds or coffee pods that never taste watered down. Customize your brew with 9 grounds sizes from single serve, to travel mug, to full carafe and 4 pod sizes from 6 to 12 oz. Plus, it features Delay Brew and Keep Warm Functions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good value coffee maker
reviews.reviewText: My father was a coffee salesman, so I’ve been drinking coffee over 50 years, a tradition I’ve passed on to our children as well. I previously owned an earlier model of the Ninja which brewed perfect cups of coffee 4 to 8 times a day for over seven years before that sad day came when it was time to retire it and search for a new coffee maker.I was hoping to buy the same model, but it had been long discontinued. I searched for the new Ninja models and settled upon the CFP101. It has not disappointed. An unexpected benefit was the ability to brew K-cups as well. We host a small house church in our home on Sundays and it’s difficult to predict how much coffee to brew. Living in the Pacific Northwest, I’ve become somewhat of a coffee snob and only buy locally roasted coffees. I hate wasting those precious grinds so having a Kcup option for the church has worked out wonderfully. No more pouring out half-full pots of coffee.My only complaint is that the coffee pot mouth is a little too wide. If I get too ambitious with my pour, it often misses my cup and spills out onto the counter. I’ve compensated by pouring more slowly so it isn’t a deal breaker for me.I highly recommend this machine to my fellow coffee lovers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars As good as a Hario V60
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Ninja coffee machine. My first machine has a second brew basket for tea, a frothier and a metal carafe. I have had it for about 4 years and it still works very well. I bought this one because I wanted the k cup option and I liked the many options it offered. It makes outstanding coffee. I do believe it is as good as a Hario V60– which is the gold standard for coffee excellence. I have tried k cups but the taste is not as good. I buy only coffee beans and grind them just before brewing them. K cups use coffee that was ground months or even years before they used. There is no doubt that freshly ground coffee is the best. And this Ninja coffee machine Brews this freshly ground coffee to perfection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolute best coffee maker ever!
reviews.reviewText: First, lets get the negative vibe about Ninja coffee makers out of the way. Do they have some problems? YES I myself had one that went bad in 6 months. So I just bought another one. People don't stop buying cars because of breakdowns. Purchase the extended warranty if you are worried. Don't let negative reviews stop you from buying the best coffee maker on the market. This model is by far their best. It brews great coffee. SUPER easy to clean. I use it both as a drip and a pod. The pod of course is very limited so I use it mostly as drip. The temp is right on for making good coffee. I have learned that cleaning can make a major difference taking care of any coffee pots. Maybe more with Ninja. I have hard water so I clean mine once a month. Have had no problems so far. Give it a try. It won't dissapoint!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Cup Every Time
reviews.reviewText: Tried three different coffee pots before finally getting the one we like! Able to make a pot of coffee or a single cup using a pod! So easy to use! Love this coffee center!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not sure how anyone is using this machine
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This machine failed epically on the very first use right out of the box. The second one I captured on the video posted to this review, the first cup was definitely worse. Out of the first 3 pods I tried, only one was ok but the coffee tasted bad.Once I opened the outer box the product box was inside, the tape on the inner box was applied when it was in the outer box and the bags inside were torn and not packed like a manufacturer would do, I assume this was already returned for the same reason I returned it for since it appeared I was not the first person to open this package.I followed directions right from the manual step by step and used several different brands of pods all produced similar results. This machine is not capable of performing the primary function, the very reason it was created to brew a cup of coffee. This is the second model ninja that is incapable of producing a cup of coffee that is not full of grounds. To be clear I'm not talking a few specks in the bottom of the cup, I'm talking emptying the majority of the pod content into the cup. I will sadly never have enough trust to buy another ninja project again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very nice machine.
reviews.reviewText: We had been using a Hamilton Beech combination coffee maker, but we're disappointed with how flimsy it was constructed. The lid for the caraf coffee chamber warped to the point that it could no longer function. Also, with a built in water reservoir, if you accidentally over filled it on the k-cup side, it would refuse to function. We didn't hate it, but we needed something else. This Ninja machine is much sturdier in its construction. There are more parts do deal with, but they fit so well and have a place to store them. The seperate and removable water reservoir is so convenient. So far, we are happy with this purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars We really like the versatility!
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I have very different morning routines, I get up for work 3 hours before her. I used to make a pot of coffee and the remainder would be cold and old by the time she got upthis makes it easy to adjust the amount of coffee made, and strength. Also iced coffee if wanted. You don’t need to buy the expensive k cups but can use them if you likeYou can also set a timer which is very nice. I can make my coffee for work then set another batch to brew up for my wife when she’s getting ready…. Happy wife…happy life!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Been using the OXO pour over for years and finally decided to buy a coffee maker with a timer so it’s all ready when my alarm goes off in the morning. It’s taking me a bit to get used to the settings but wow it’s wonderful. And since I live alone it’s great to get a delicious single cup (I use grounds although there is a an adaptor for k-cups)! Don’t hesitate with this one!

Estaba entre comprar una keurig o está de ninja y elegí está porque me daba por el mismo precio no sólo el uso de cápsulas sino también café de “cafetera”, sin duda la recomiendo y la volvería a comprar.
